alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley; Eastern Antelope Valley Foothills; Eastern San Gabriel Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 7:12PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Los Angeles County including the Antelope Valley and adjacent foothills through 815 PM PDT... At 709 PM PDT, a strong thunderstorm was reported 7 miles east of Lake Los Angeles, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail, along with frequent lightning and heavy downpours capable of localized flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Los Angeles, Wrightwood, Pearblossom, Llano, Valyermo, Saddleback Butte State Park, Big Pines, Falling Springs, portions of the Angeles Crest Highway and Highway 138 between Llano and the San Bernardino County line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Antelope Valley; Eastern Antelope Valley Foothills; Eastern San Gabriel Mountains
